newsitem.title: GERMANY: Water reaches highest level in 50 years in Germany.
newsitem.headline: Water reaches highest level in 50 years in Germany.

text.p: The Oder river on Sunday reached its highest level for 50 years in an east German town on the border with Poland, raising fears that dykes could burst under the strain.
Matthias Platzeck, the regional government's environment minister, said the water was putting huge pressure on the dykes, which had also been weakened by heavy rain.
The rain also caused problems in the southern state of Bavaria, where high water levels trapped a group of potholers.
Police said rescuers had to bring the group to safety after the water cut off some passages in the Salzgrabenhoehle caves.
